posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Something I‚Äôve always wanted to do is to crowdfund printing Signal stickers and have Signal enthusiasts replace any mention of WhatsApp, Facebook Instagram and the likes in public places by the Signal logo or name. The goal being to bring attention to the fact that those logo‚Äôs are everywhere while it‚Äôs time for change.
I might also set up a website to which the stickers can refer to inform why it‚Äôs important to think about which messenger you are using. Pasting stickers in public spaces is often not entirely legal, so this would have to be a on your own risk non-official campaign, not seeing to shame those who use other messengers, but merely to inform people that you do have a choice.

In the Netherlands for example it‚Äôs not at all uncommon to see the WhatsApp name and logo on official street signs indicating a neighborhood watch. These signs are everywhere, and they adhere to certain standards such as reflecting light when headlights shine on them. Personally I am very annoyed with the fact that we allow these kinds of public advertisements for a ‚Äúfor profit‚Äù messenger which is also collecting your metadata. It would be really awesome if we could print reflective Signal stickers and start replacing those signs throughout the country, just to make people aware of the alternative. I would also like to start a dialog with the people behind those WhatsApp signs to see if in the future they would consider using Signal instead of WhatsApp.

Another thing which would really help is if businesses can use Signal, so they are inclined to have the Signal logo printed on their vans or store windows instead of the WhatsApp logo.

I‚Äôm not a fan of neighborhood watches, nor of sticker campaigns, and especially not of pasting stickers on things which the owner doesn‚Äôt agree with, but crowd sourcing stickers might be a helpful to those who want to switch, and I would love to set up an awareness campaign.
I don‚Äôt know if having people associate Signal with sticker vandalism is helpful though‚Ä¶?

I don‚Äôt understand the point of replacing other logos. The reason those other logos are there in the first place is to say ‚Äúthis group can be found on WhatsApp‚Äù, and I would assume it would mean those are either public groups that can be found via search or the posting would also include information for how to otherwise join the group. Replacing the logo with Signal would not be helpful unless that group was on Signal.

Better to just post things advertising Signal, or when you create groups of your own, create them on Signal and share the link.

For reference, at least related:

Can I use Signal for a large neighbourhood crime prevention group? General Discussion
I hate how our government is promoting Whatsapp by allowing all these neighborhood prevention signs: [serveimage] I wish some party would open a court case to fight this government supported promotion of a commercial platform. I have researched if I could start such case, but I am not a party of interest. If an organization like Open Whisper Systems would start the case, there is a huge change they will win it. It would also get a lot of media attention. So to get back on topic, @janvlug pl‚Ä¶
Signal media coverage ‚Äî articles & news General Discussion
In Dutch, an article and podcast regarding neighborhood apps intended to enhance local security: The suggestion is to move away from WhatsApp to Signal for this purpose. Also to my disliking the Dutch government supports the so called WhatsApp buurtpreventie with signs when entering neighborhoods. These guys put up a similar sign referring to Signal instead of WhatsApp.

link_counts.title: Can I use Signal for a large neighbourhood crime prevention group?

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Herohtar:

The reason those other logos are there in the first place is to say ‚Äúthis group can be found on WhatsApp‚Äù,

No, the logos are there because they are easily recognized by anyone and are warning potential trouble makers that some people are keeping an eye open and talk about anything they consider unusual and alarming in the neighbourhood so they‚Äôd better go somewhere else.

Hmm, because you said public places, many websites offer the ability to add font icons (FontAwesome being a popular open source choice). They don‚Äôt yet have a Signal icon (but do for Instagram/FB/WhatsApp) so I‚Äôd suggest people here upvote this issue on GitHub.

github.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome

Icon request: icon-signal-messenger [+ fork with iOS icon]

patcon

posts.name: Johan Vromans
posts.cooked:
I think it wouild be more effective to promote an generic icon for messengers. For a neighbourhood watch group it is irrelevant whether it is on Signal or WhatsApp or whatever, the people that form the group know where it is, and the preventive effect is that the group exists, not on what messenger it is located.

I fully agree that in hindsight it was wrong to make these signs promoting a for profit company for public purposes, but that was the only option at the time. It is changing ‚Äî remember, a number of years ago our government wanted us to use Facebook for communications, and it still uses X.

Meteor0id:

They exist now, time to start the war on WhatsApp neighborhood signs!

Doesn‚Äôt it make more sense to actually migrate those groups first?

posts.name: Michel
posts.cooked:
sciurius:

I think it wouild be more effective to promote an generic icon for messengers. For a neighbourhood watch group it is irrelevant whether it is on Signal or WhatsApp or whatever, the people that form the group know where it is, and the preventive effect is that the group exists, not on what messenger it is located.

Agreed, let me explain the background of these Signal stickers and signs, because I was part of the co-creation. You can read it in NL here: Nieuw: Signal buurtpreventie-borden en stickers beschikbaar - Signalapp.nl but let me explain in English below for other forum members:

First step was that we (with unofficial website Signalapp.nl) called our municipality to replace the WhatsApp signs with neutral signs (see: Weg met die WhatsApp-borden! Of toch niet? - Signalapp.nl and open letter here ( Signal Buurtpreventie veiliger dan WhatsApp Buurtpreventie )

Not totally unexpected given the costs, but we received a hard NO on making them neutral, so we were like: ‚ÄúOkay, if that‚Äôs how you want it‚Äù‚Ä¶ Municipalities do not want to replace WhatsApp signs with neutral signs? Then we are introducing Signal signs and stickers.

People cannot promote their Signal group with a WhatsApp sign, can they? (TBH, we even don‚Äôt have a Signal neighbourhoodwatch group but don‚Äôt tell anyone)

So then we contacted the largest sign factory in the Netherlands that also makes the WhatsApp signs, and together we designed the stickers and signs, after which they took care of the rest.

We also did this to promote Signal in their popular WhatsApp sign webshop and Signal now has a nice place on their homepage:

image1409√ó715 128 KB

It also gained exposure on the major Dutch tech site Bright for Signal, which otherwise wouldn‚Äôt have happened so regardless of whether people buy them, it‚Äôs already successful and has probably led to a few discussions or some food for thought here and there (Bright: Binnenkort bij jou in de buurt: borden met 'Signal Buurtpreventie' )

For those wondering: The use of Signal‚Äôs logo has been officially approved. Sales and commercial activities are entirely handled by Buurtpreventiebord.nl of TrafficSupply; we (Signalapp.nl) and Signal itself earn nothing from this.

So to come back the point of @sciurius, fully agreed that neutral signs would make more sense, it‚Äôs irrelevant what app is used. The Signal signs and stickers are just a result of municipalities that don‚Äôt want to replace WhatsApp signs with neutral signs. People in NL now have a choice.

To be honest, imo it‚Äôs still unclear how much of a deterrent these signs actually are and if they are not disturbing or distracting for traffic. They can also just remove the WhatsApp signs.

Bottom line: if WhatsApp groups are allowed to put a sign or stickers on their street, why are Signal groups not allowed to do so?

We did our part to make at least some signs and stickers available for Signal, the rest is up to everyone else in the Netherlands and their municipalities Like @Meteor0id says, it‚Äôs time Replace them with neutral ones, remove them entirely, and if the municipality doesn‚Äôt want that, request to put up Signal signs for your Signal group. It‚Äôs unfair if they don‚Äôt approve it.

Below some more photos, day and night view

1fbc05ef799ed321ea21036c3f14b014133fea5d1920√ó3410 743 KB

20250820_1851271920√ó3410 710 KB

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
We are migrating the groups end of this month in my municipality, slowed down because we want to keep poilice on board een thouh they hardly contribute these days. I am not a fan of neihborhood watches at all, but since they exist I rather be pissing out from inside and see if we can make them Signal groups. goal is to normalise Signal. Method is making sure people have more groups on Signal, fewer on whatsapp, and removing whatsapp from our public spaces

The groups and the signs have been subject of seperate studies. Most concluded they don‚Äôt work at all to prevent crime. My only take is, fuck Meta. Baby steps until we reach the tipping point. If Signal maintains feature parity that is! Already seeing resistance because Signal does not support communities (multiple groups as a community) and decriptions can‚Äôt be pinned in groups.

@Contributor succesfully ot a little bit of movement going in terms of publicity. However the stickers are still too small to place on top of existing signs, might not stick for long on the coating, and replacing signs is too costly at this time.
